meanings.definition: A smaller group within a larger cluster.
meanings.sent1: In the forest, the subcluster of trees near the river stood out.
meanings.sent2: The subcluster of stars in the night sky was particularly bright.
meanings.sent3: The subcluster of students at the back of the class whispered secrets.
meanings.sent4: The subcluster of colorful houses on the hill looked like a painting.
meanings.sent5: The subcluster of birds chirping in the morning created a peaceful atmosphere.

meanings.definition: To form a smaller group within a larger cluster.
meanings.sent1: The students decided to subcluster together for the group project.
meanings.sent2: Birds tend to subcluster in the trees during migration season.
meanings.sent3: The ants subclustered around the fallen piece of candy.
meanings.sent4: The stars subclustered into beautiful constellations in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The flowers subclustered around the fountain, creating a colorful display.
